text: The CONCACAF Gold Cup (Spanish: Copa de Oro de la CONCACAF) is an association football tournament held every two years between national teams that are members of CONCACAF. The first tournament was held in 1991. Before 1991, the CONCACAF Championship was the first organized tournament for national teams in the region. The CONCACAF Championship was abolished in 1989. The CONCACAF Gold Cup features teams from Central America, North America and the Caribbean. The Mexico national football team has been the most successful team in the tournament. They have won 8 times. == Results == Results by Edition and Final Score Edition Year Host(s) Final Number of teams Winners Score Runners-up 1 1991 0–0 (4–3 pen.) 8 2 1993 4–0 8 3 1996 2–0 9 4 1998 1–0 10 5 2000 2–0 12 6 2002 2–0 12 7 2003 1–0 a.e.t. 12 8 2005 0–0 (3–1 pen.) 12 9 2007 2–1 12 10 2009 5–0 12 11 2011 4–2 12 12 2013 1–0 12 13 2015 3–1 12 14 2017 2–1 12 15 2019 1–0 16 16 2021 16 * a.e.t.: after extra time * a.s.d.e.t.: after sudden death extra time * pen: after penalty shoot-out == Performance by nation == Team Winners Runners-up Third Place Fourth Place 9 (1993, 1996, 1998, 2003, 2009, 2011, 2015, 2019, 2023) 1 (2007) 3 (1991, 2013, 2017) — 7 (1991, 2002, 2005, 2007, 2013, 2017, 2021) 4 (1993, 1998, 2009, 2011) 2 (1996, 2003) 1 (2015) 1 (2000) — 2 (2002, 2007) — — 2 (2005, 2013) 2 (2011, 2015) — — 2 (2015, 2017) 1 (1993) 1 (1998) — 2 (1996, 2003) 1 (1998) — — 1 (1991) 4 (2005, 2009, 2011, 2013) — — 1 (2002) 3 (1993, 2009, 2017) 2 (1991, 2003) — 1 (2000) 1 (2005) — — — 1 (2000) — — — 1 (2000) — — — 1 (2007) — — — — 1 (1996) — — — 1 (2002) * The teams in italics were invited to the tournament, and they are not a member of CONCACAF. == Other websites == *CONCACAF Gold Cup official website Category:1991 establishments in North America Category:Football in North America Category:Football in Central America
